Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can draw two students standing apart, suggesting an attempt to communicate over a distance.
The student can attempt to include basic representations of a string telephone using two cups and a string.
The student may show a string connecting the cups held by each student, indicating some understanding of the mechanism.
CANNOT: The student might not accurately show that the string must be tense for sound to travel effectively (string may appear slack or disconnected).
The student may not clearly depict how sound travels through the string (e.g., no lines/arrows indicating sound waves).
The student might misunderstand the concept of sound transmission, possibly indicating that sound travels through air only (drawing might lack labels or incorrect use of arrows).
The student may not label or describe how the device utilizes sound to communicate (e.g., no mention of sound or communication).
